{{disambig-more|The Lord of the Rings|[[The Lord of the Rings (disambiguation)]]}}
<center>{{quote|The '''Lord of the Ring''' is not Frodo, but the master of the [[Dark Tower]] of [[Mordor]]...|[[Gandalf]]  in ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]'', "[[Many Meetings]]"}}</center>
[[File:Kenneth Sofia - The Nazgul.png|thumb|''The Nazgul'' by [[:Category:Images by Kenneth Sofia|Kenneth Sofia]]]]
'''Lord of the Ring''' or '''Lord of the Rings''' was a title for '''[[Sauron]]''', the master of [[the One Ring]]. The singular form appeared twice when [[Peregrin Took]] tried to apply it to [[Frodo Baggins]], but the [[Istari|Wizard]] [[Gandalf]] corrected him.<ref>{{FR|Meetings}}, p. 226</ref> The plural form appeared thrice: once spoken by Gandalf in the aforementioned conversation, a second time by [[Glorfindel]] during the [[Council of Elrond]],<ref>{{FR|Council}}, p. 266</ref> and a third time by Frodo while writing the [[Red Book of Westmarch]].<ref>{{RK|Havens}}, p. 1027</ref>

==Elvish translation==
Two known translations of ''the Lord of the Rings'' into [[Quenya]] by [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] exist:

*'''''Heru Imillion'''''<ref>{{webcite|author=[[Åke Bertenstam]]|articleurl=http://www.forodrim.org/daeron/mdtci.html|articlename=DTS 54 - Heru imillion|website=[http://www.forodrim.org/daeron/md_home.html Mellonath Daeron]|accessed=22 December 2020}}</ref>
*'''''i Túrin i [[Corma]]ron'''''<ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], "[[Letter to Philip Brown]]" (letter)</ref>
